intro: Lobelia seineri, commonly known as the slender lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Lobelia seineri is often found in clusters and is known for its ornamental value in native gardens.
